thread.title: Trades bet Wal-Mart is too cheap - Yahoo Finance
thread.title_full: Trades bet Wal-Mart is too cheap - Yahoo Finance

author: David Russell (david.russell@optionmonster.com)
title: Trades bet Wal-Mart is too cheap - Yahoo Finance
text:
Wal-Mart Stores is known for low prices, and now traders apparently think that the stock is too cheap.

optionMONSTER's tracking programs detected the sale of 11,000 November 45 puts for $0.08 and $0.09 on Friday. There was no open interest when the session began, which means new positions were initiated.

These short puts generate income but obligate traders to buy shares if they drop below $45 by expiration in mid-November. The strategy makes money from the passage of time and reflects a belief that downside is limited. (See our Education section)

WMT fell 1.75 percent to $63.34 and has lost more than one-quarter of its value this year. The discount retailer has struggled with slowing sales, currency moves, and worries about higher wage costs. 

Shares are now back near the same area where they peaked in early 2012, which could make chart watchers think that they'll hold support. The put seller is also betting against a major drop into the next earnings report on Nov. 17.

Total option volume was twice average amounts in the session.
